pkgmetadata.longdescription: # img2arrayPrints the pixels of an image into an array of RGB values.This can be copied easily to other applications, such as embedded apps.# Commands-h, --help : Help text -i, --image : Image file path -p, --prefix : Prefix for the item, like "colorFunc\(" -P, --postfix : Postfix for the item, like "\)" -f, --format : Format of the color, defaults to RGB. Possible values: RGB, RGBA, Hex, HexAlpha # Install`pip install img2array`# Example`img2array -i file.png --prefix=coolFunction\( --postfix=\) --format=RGB`**Note**: the \ before () may be required or not depending on the shell you're using.This should print an array version of the image like```{ {coolFunction(200,200,200), coolFunction(123,123,123)}, {coolFunction(111,111,111), coolFunction(41,0,12)}}```You can then easily copy-paste this to your applications.
